snippet: Mohanbhai Ramchandani, suit maker for famous athletes, confessed to tax evasion and agreed to spend 1 to 3 years in prison and pay $5.5 million in back taxes and penalties.
abstract: Tailor Mohanbhai Ramchandani admits to collecting $1.7 million in taxes from customers that he did not pay and to underpaying his personal income taxes by $256,000; pleads guilty to tax evasion charges in State Supreme Court in Manhattan and agrees to serve prison sentence of one to three years and pay $5.5 million in back taxes an penalties.
lead_paragraph: Mohanbhai Ramchandani, suit maker for famous athletes, confessed to tax evasion and agreed to spend 1 to 3 years in prison and pay $5.5 million in back taxes and penalties.

headline.seo: Tailor Who Outfitted Athletes Admits Cheating on Taxes
headline.main: A Tailor Admits Underpaying on His Taxes by the Millions
